page.title: 07 Jogging on Skipwith Common
page.content: The route and length of my run depend upon whether I am moving well by the time I reach the mile tree, a large oak some three hundred yards short of the Common proper. I am feeling good-today is a four miler so I make a left turn along the first broad runway at the end of which I burst through bush and cobwebs to join a narrow track which leads straight for Skipwith's square church tower. However, before the village is reached I join tarmac and I am heading Riccallwards again. I have seen a solitary Curlew, dozens of Magpies and Pigeons. I have frightened scores of Rabbits including one black one and put up numerous grouse and pheasant. I have heard a shot in the distance. I have seen no deer, vehicles or people.
